Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Milwaukee Mayor Tom Barrett "has never been to a juvenile facility," when there is evidence that he has visited numerous other facilities.
Understate: The claim understates the efforts made by Mayor Barrett to advocate for creating a facility closer to the families of inmates, as well as his initial proposal to reopen Ethan Allen in Waukesha County.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to conclude that Mayor Barrett "didn't want it to be done" regarding the juvenile facility in Milwaukee.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim that Mayor Barrett did not want a juvenile facility in Milwaukee, as he initially proposed reopening Ethan Allen in Waukesha County but later supported a city site.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not considering the Mayor's concerns about the possibility of violent offenders being placed in neighborhood group homes instead of a secure facility.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that Mayor Barrett's lack of visit to Lincoln Hills means he has never been to a juvenile facility, when there is evidence that he has visited other facilities.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Mayor Barrett and Milwaukee County Sheriff Earnell Lucas attended a "Dinners with Winners" event with youths at Milwaukee's Ujima House, which is a juvenile facility.
